snippet: As governments and aid agencies worldwide confront a migrant crisis, the nominee to lead the United States agency responsible for overseas humanitarian issues is stalled in the Senate.
abstract: Gayle Smith, nominee to head United States Agency for International Development, is stuck in partisan Senate tussle as government is readying response to Middle East and Africa refugee crisis; she is veteran on international aid issues.
lead_paragraph: As governments and aid agencies worldwide confront a migrant crisis, the nominee to lead the United States agency responsible for overseas humanitarian issues is stalled in the Senate.

headline.main: Partisan Tussle Keeps Top U.S. Aid Job Vacant
headline.print_headline: Partisan Tussle Keeps Top U.S. Aid Job Vacant
